title: Git-absorb: Git commit â€“fixup, but automatic
dot: digraph git_absorb{node[shape=box, style="rounded,filled", fontname="Arial", fontsize=10, width=3];subgraph cluster_functionality{label="Functionality";style=dashed;func1[label="Automates commit adjustments", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#cce5ff"];func2[label="Absorbs changes into previous commits", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#cce5ff"];func3[label="Uses fixup! commits for atomicity", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#cce5ff"];func4[label="Avoids manual rebasing", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#cce5ff"];func1->func2->func3->func4;}subgraph cluster_usage{label="Usage";style=dotted;use1[label="git add files", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#ffcc99"];use2[label="git absorb", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#ffcc99"];use3[label="git rebase -i --autosquash", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#ffcc99"];use1->use2->use3;}subgraph cluster_configuration{label="Configuration";style=dotted;config1[label="maxStack = 50", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#e6f7ff"];config2[label="oneFixupPerCommit = true", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#e6f7ff"];config3[label="autoStageIfNothingStaged = true", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#e6f7ff"];config4[label="fixupTargetAlwaysSHA = true", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#e6f7ff"];config1->config2->config3->config4;}subgraph cluster_installation{label="Installation";style=dotted;install1[label="Install via package manager", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#f2e6ff"];install2[label="Compile from source using cargo", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#f2e6ff"];install1->install2;}func4->use1[label="After configuring"];use3->config1[label="Check maxStack"];install1->install2[label="Download and setup"];labelloc="t";label="Overview of git absorb";}

title: Hacking Kia: Remotely Controlling Cars with Just a License Plate
dot:
digraph KiaVulnerabilities{rankdir=LR;node[shape=box];Introduction[label="Introduction
- Vulnerabilities discovered on June 11, 2024
- Allowed remote control of Kia vehicles using license plates
- Attacker could access personal info and add themselves as a user
- Tool created to demonstrate impact (not released)
- Vulnerabilities fixed, no malicious exploitation reported" shape=rect]; Vulnerabilities[label="Vulnerabilities
- Remote control of key functions
- Personal information access
- Adding invisible second user" shape=rect]; Vehicles_Affected[label="Vehicles Affected
- List of specific Kia models with vulnerabilities" shape=rect]; Attack_Process[label="Attack Process
1. Enter license plate
2. Execute commands in 30 seconds" shape=rect]; Vulnerability_Writeup[label="Vulnerability Writeup
- Previous findings on multiple car companies
- Focused on Kia's web and app interfaces
- Discovered dealer infrastructure vulnerabilities" shape=rect]; Steps[label="Steps to Exploit
1. Generate dealer token
2. Retrieve victim's info
3. Modify owner's access
4. Add attacker as primary owner" shape=rect]; Conclusion[label="Conclusion
- Ongoing vulnerabilities in vehicles
- Comparison to software vulnerabilities" shape=rect]; Credit[label="Credit
- Neiko Rivera, Sam Curry, Justin Rhinehart, Ian Carroll, Kenneth Lugo" shape=rect];Introduction->Vulnerabilities;Introduction->Vehicles_Affected;Introduction->Attack_Process;Introduction->Vulnerability_Writeup;Vulnerability_Writeup->Steps;Steps->Conclusion;Conclusion->Credit;}

title: U.S. court orders LibGen to pay $30M to publishers, issues broad injunction
dot:
digraph LibGen{rankdir=LR;node[shape=box];LibGen[label="Library Genesis (LibGen)
- Shadow Library
- Free access to millions of books
- Operates despite legal challenges"]; LegalChallenges[label="Legal Challenges
- Court orders to block LibGen
- Attempts to shut down by rightsholders
- Anonymous operators complicate enforcement"]; Lawsuit[label="Lawsuit by Publishers
- Cengage, Macmillan, Pearson, etc.
- Accusations of staggering copyright infringement
- Default judgment for $30 million"]; CourtOrder[label="Court Order
- Defendants responsible for willful copyright infringement
- $150,000 per work, total $30 million
- Injunction against third-party services"]; ThirdPartyServices[label="Third-Party Services
- Advertising networks
- Payment processors
- Hosting providers
- IPFS gateways"]; DomainSeizure[label="Domain Seizure
- Order to disable LibGen domains
- Includes libgen.is, libgen.rs, etc.
- Future domain names also targeted"]; LibGen->LegalChallenges;LegalChallenges->Lawsuit;Lawsuit->CourtOrder;CourtOrder->ThirdPartyServices;CourtOrder->DomainSeizure; subgraph cluster_publishers{label="Publishers";style=dashed;Cengage[label="Cengage"];Macmillan[label="Macmillan Learning"];Pearson[label="Pearson Education"];McGrawHill[label="McGraw Hill"];Bedford[label="Bedford"];Cengage->Lawsuit;Macmillan->Lawsuit;Pearson->Lawsuit;McGrawHill->Lawsuit;Bedford->Lawsuit;}}

title: Attacking UNIX Systems via CUPS
dot:
digraph CUPS_RCE_Attack{rankdir=LR;node[shape=box, style=filled, color="#ffcccc"];subgraph cluster_intro{label="Introduction";color="#ffcc99";Introduction[label="Exploit CUPS on GNU/Linux systems
via RCE vulnerabilities"];}subgraph cluster_vulnerabilities{label="Vulnerabilities";color="#ffcccc";Vulnerabilities[label="CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175, CVE-2024-47177"];}subgraph cluster_impact{label="Impact";color="#ccccff";Impact[label="Remote unauthenticated attacker
can execute arbitrary commands"];}subgraph cluster_entry_points{label="Entry Points";color="#ccffcc";EntryPoints[label="WAN / public internet: UDP port 631
LAN: spoof zeroconf / mDNS / DNS-SD"];}subgraph cluster_affected_systems{label="Affected Systems";color="#ffcccc";AffectedSystems[label="Most GNU/Linux distributions
Some BSDs, Google Chromium / ChromeOS
Oracle Solaris, Possibly more"];}subgraph cluster_remediation{label="Remediation";color="#ccccff";Remediation[label="Disable cups-browsed service
Update CUPS package
Block UDP port 631 and DNS-SD traffic"];}Introduction->Vulnerabilities;Vulnerabilities->Impact;Impact->EntryPoints;EntryPoints->AffectedSystems;AffectedSystems->Remediation;}
